newsitem.title: INDIA: Kashmir grenade attack kills one, wounds five.
newsitem.headline: Kashmir grenade attack kills one, wounds five.

text.p: One person was killed and at least five wounded on Monday when separatist guerrillas hurled a grenade at a police patrol in a crowded market in Kashmir, police said.
They said militants lobbed the grenade at police in the crowed Jehangir Chowk area of Srinagar, summer capital of India's Jammu and Kashmir state.
The device missed the target and exploded on the road, injuring six pedestrians. One of them died on the way to hospital, police said.
More than a dozen militant groups are fighting for Kashmir's independence or merger with neighbouring Pakistan.
Police and hospitals say more than 20,000 people have died in insurgency-related violence since a separatist revolt erupted in the Himalayan region in 1990.
Separatists and the state's chief minister, Farooq Abdullah, say more than 50,000 have died.
